params.data: The resulting data from the call. This is error data when the call was not a success. Otherwise,                this is malformed data when the call was a success.
params.success: If the call to the token was a success.

params.amount: The amount of underlying or yield tokens returned by the operation.
params.minimumAmountOut: The minimum amount of the underlying or yield token that was expected when performing                         the operation.

params.amount: The amount of yield-tokens to redeem.
params.minimumAmountOut: The minimum amount of underlying tokens that are acceptable coming out from the                         operation.
params.recipient: The recipient of the resulting underlying-tokens.

returns._0: The amount of underlying tokens unwrapped to `recipient`.

params.amount: The amount of the underlying token to wrap.
params.minimumAmountOut: The minimum amount of yield tokens that are acceptable coming out from the operation.
params.recipient: The address which will receive the yield tokens.

returns._0: The amount of yield tokens minted to `recipient`.

token.return: The address of the yield token.

returns._0: The address of the yield token.

underlyingToken.return: The address of the underlying token.

returns._0: The address of the underlying token.

ERC20CallFailed(address,bool,bytes).notice: An error used to indicate that a call to an ERC20 contract failed.

IllegalState().notice: An error used to indicate that an action could not be completed because the contract either already existed         or entered an illegal condition which is not recoverable from.

SlippageExceeded(uint256,uint256).notice: An error which is used to indicate that the slippage of a wrap or unwrap operation was exceeded.

price().notice: Gets the number of underlying tokens that a single whole yield token is redeemable for.

token().notice: Gets the address of the yield token that this adapter supports.

underlyingToken().notice: Gets the address of the underlying token that the yield token wraps.

unwrap(uint256,address,uint256).notice: Unwraps `amount` yield tokens into the underlying token.

wrap(uint256,address,uint256).notice: Wraps `amount` underlying tokens into the yield token.
